explanations.A: What is the value of the missing angle? Do all triangles have a hypotenuse?
explanations.B: What is the value of the missing angle? Do all triangles have a hypotenuse?
explanations.C: What is the value of the missing angle? Do all triangles have a hypotenuse?
explanations.D: This triangle does not have a hypotenuse because it is not a right-angled triangle. The missing angle is 180° - 52° - 48° = 80°, not 90°.

explanations.A: What is the value of the missing angle? Can we use this to find the hypotenuse?
explanations.B: The missing angle is 180° - 56° - 34° = 90°, and so this is a right-angled triangle. B is the longest side, so this is the hypotenuse.

explanations.A: The missing angle is 180° - 52° - 38° = 90°, and so this is a right-angle triangle. The longest side (the hypotenuse) is always opposite the right angle, so A is the correct answer.
